title: Upgrade react-native-launch-arguments to latest

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem
When the version of `react-native-launch-arguments` we use in our app is `^4.0.2`, if we try to upgrade to RN 0.82+, then we have errors.

Solution
Upgrade `react-native-launch-arguments` to latest.

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @dominictb</details>

title: Deleting a draft report from search deletes the expenses as well.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**v9.3.3-2
**Reproducible in staging?:** Y
**Reproducible in production?:**Y
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** No
**Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): NA, discovered in testing something else.

## Action Performed:
1. Create a report
2. Add two expenses to it 
3. Go to Reports > Reports
4. Select the report
5. Click Delete > Confirm
6. Observe the report is deleted and the expenses are deleted.

## Expected Result:
The report should be deleted, and the expenses should be unreported.

## Actual Result:
The report is deleted and the expenses are deleted.

I _think_ this might be because we seem to be calling `DeleteMoneyRequestOnSearch` when you've bulk selected `type:expense-report` results, instead of maybe `DeleteAppReport` which when called from within the report directly seems to work as expected. ðŸ¤” 

## Workaround:
Click into the report > More > Delete. The report will be deleted, and the expenses unreported. 

## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/35e2ae7c-b33b-42ec-b4c9-4023a070e4b6

title: [$250] Prevent incorrect usage of loading indicator components

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
We have improved our loading indicator components so that users are always able to recover from an infinite loading issue. We now show a button within `FullScreenLoadingIndicator` after 10 seconds. [Original issue](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/69850). We have almost completed the refactor to ensure that `FullScreenLoadingIndicator` and the alternative `ActivityIndicator` and used correctly: - `FullScreenLoadingIndicator` - full page load component - `ActivityIndicator` - Loading within a component, or when a back button is already rendered We now want to prevent engineers from incorrectly using the above components. For example, to prevent two back buttons from being rendered, or to ensure the user is always able to escape without needing to kill the app. ### Solution Lets attempt to flag incorrect usages.

body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.3-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** N **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @sakluger **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1768434931178269) ## Action Performed: Precondition: Have Expensify Cards enabled in a workspace 1. Go to Reports > Reconciliation 2. Filter "Withdrawal type" to "Expensify Card" 3. Hover over and click the checkbox next to any of the settlement rows 4. Click on the row to expand it 5. Click the checkbox next to the expanded row 6. Collapse the row 7. Click the checkbox next to the collapsed row ## Expected Result: The user should be able to select the checkbox next to any settlement row. ## Actual Result: Staging behavior : Unable to select the check box after expanding the report as well Production behavior : The checkbox can't be selected before the row has been expanded. It can be selected after expanding the row, and can still be selected after collapsing the row. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fcfa39e8-b8c4-4a0a-9939-044b8e8b5c89 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
